title: Duval's Identity Speculation Before Reveal
theory: Before episode 389's reveal, fans speculated that Duval could be various returning characters hiding behind the iron mask, including Don Krieg, T Bone, or Bellamy. Some theorized he might be a character seeking revenge for a past defeat by the Straw Hats.
author: One Piece Community
resolution: Episode 389 revealed that Duval was not a returning character but a new character whose face matched Sanji's wanted poster

title: Sanji's Wanted Poster Gag as Future Plot Point
theory: Some fans theorized that Sanji's poorly-drawn wanted poster, introduced as a running gag, would eventually become relevant to the plot. The theory suggested that Oda wouldn't waste such a memorable detail and would eventually pay it off in a meaningful way.
author: Various One Piece Analysts
resolution: Episode 389 confirmed this theory by revealing Duval's face matched the wanted poster, transforming the gag into a plot point

title: Motobaro Incident as Conqueror's Haki Foreshadowing
theory: In retrospect, fans theorized that Luffy knocking out Motobaro without touching it in episode 389 was an early display of Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki). Though played for comedy at the time, this moment parallels Shanks scaring off the Sea King in chapter 1 and represents unconscious use of this rare power.
author: One Piece Community
resolution: Later episodes confirmed that Luffy possesses Conqueror's Haki, retroactively explaining the Motobaro incident as an early unconscious use

title: Duval's Face Transformation Permanence
theory: After Sanji's Parage Shot transformed Duval's face, some fans theorized that the transformation might be temporary and his face would revert to its original form, or that he might be able to change it back and forth at will.
author: One Piece Community
resolution: Subsequent episodes confirmed the transformation is permanent, with Duval maintaining his handsome appearance
